content: Tomer Galanti | Deep Learning Fundamentals Lab Skip to content About & Research We are the Deep Learning Fundamentals group at Texas A&M, led by Prof. Tomer Galanti. We connect rigorous theory with practical algorithms to understand and improve modern deep learning and large language models. Theory of LLM reasoning: Which architectures, objectives, and training procedures reliably improve multi-step reasoning in LLMs? LLM-ERM [1] Auto-regressive decision trees [1] DisCO: constrained optimization for reasoning [1] Rare-token depreciation bias [1] Deep representation learning: What representations do neural networks actually learn, and which ones support strong generalization? Understanding pre-training: Supervised [1, 2, 3], and self-supervised [1, 2, 3] Representation properties: Low-rank bias [1], CRH [1], and intermediate neural collapse [1, 2] See the full list of publications.
